content.en: Advanced Medical Imaging: Researchers are investigating the use of various algorithms in medical imaging to accurately predict and diagnose conditions related to pulmonary embolism and pulmonary hypertension. These algorithms, such as computed tomographic pulmonary angiography (CTPA), automated systems, logistic regression models, echocardiography, and artificial intelligence, are being studied for their ability to assess the severity of acute pulmonary embolism, detect pulmonary hypertension, identify patients at risk of circulatory collapse, and estimate pulmonary artery pressure and resistance. The goal is to develop non-invasive tools and imaging techniques that can improve the diagnosis and prognosis of these conditions.
content.da: Avanceret medicinsk billeddiagnostik: Forskere undersøger brugen af forskellige algoritmer i medicinsk billeddiagnostik for nøjagtigt at forudsige og diagnosticere tilstande relateret til lungeemboli og pulmonal hypertension. Disse algoritmer, såsom computertomografisk pulmonal angiografi (CTPA), automatiserede systemer, logistiske regressionsmodeller, ekkokardiografi og kunstig intelligens, bliver studeret for deres evne til at vurdere sværhedsgraden af akut lungeemboli, opdage pulmonal hypertension, identificere patienter i risiko for kredsløbskollaps og estimere pulmonalarterietrykket og modstanden. Målet er at udvikle ikke-invasive værktøjer og billeddiagnostiske teknikker, der kan forbedre diagnosen og prognosen af disse tilstande.
